TopicTitle: [1.2.0] Toolbar 1.7.13 - Common API for draggable/resizable buttons toolbar

Articles.Content: Well then

No I do not see the toolbar at all to configure it

I actually do have the same issue: I do not see any toolbar with 1.7.7 on KSP 0.25 anymore.

I had it visible with 1.7.6 on 0.24.2, it was configured and there are mods using it with buttons.

The "toolbar-settings.dat" is still there and untouched, as it was before.

Blizzy, could you have a look at the download link for 1.7.7 it take you to another page with an error?

*Cancel that, read a few pages back, school boy error. lol

For anyone else having the download issue you just have to press F5 on your browser to make 1.7.7 download to appear.

No. This looks like Texture Replacer coupled with Squad's own easter egg.

Could mod author or someone else upload 1.7.6 version? Thanks
I believe "Final Fronteer" has 1.7.6 packaged with it. Thats what im using. 1.7.7 doesnt work for me either. Maybe cuz im linux.
Yep, it's not like there's an "Older Releases" link in the OP...oh wait.

Thanks UAL002, "FinalFrontier0.5.6b.zip" from Curse had indeed packed in version 1.7.6. Latest version in "older releases" is... oh wait... 1.7.5, so that's why I was asking here for 1.7.6

Edited October 12, 2014 by RagnosCZ

Ah, my apologies for improperly preemtive snark.

blizzy, update yo pages!
I've added Toolbar 1.7.6 to the older releases page. Please note that I will not support older releases.
Thanks for your work on this. It's really cleaned up my KSP display! If it would be possible to add KSP-AVC support, that'd be great, it really helps keep everything up to date.

If it would be possible to add KSP-AVC support, that'd be great, it really helps keep everything up to date.

Not sure what that would add - Toolbar already comes with a built in update-checker and notifies you in game if there's one available.
Ah well nevermind then. I just noticed that it wasn't in the list of AVC mods in my game. So long as it notifies you in some way, yeah, no real reason to.

I've recently switch back from 64-bit to 32-bit KSP and now all the icons on my toolbar are tiny, and I mean so tiny that they're a white spec on the button. (those appearing on the stock toolbar from 0.25 are also fuzzy, like it's a low-res image shown blown up and shown in hi-res)

Any suggestions?

I've recently switch back from 64-bit to 32-bit KSP and now all the icons on my toolbar are tiny, and I mean so tiny that they're a white spec on the button. (those appearing on the stock toolbar from 0.25 are also fuzzy, like it's a low-res image shown blown up and shown in hi-res)

Any suggestions?

Are you running Active Texture Management? The current build of that is messing with both Blizzy and the stock toolbar.

Are you running Active Texture Management? The current build of that is messing with both Blizzy and the stock toolbar.

Ah, yes. That would explain it. Thanks :-)

small issue in 0.25:

You can click through the graphics which let me move it elsewhere on the screen for now.

Are you running Active Texture Management? The current build of that is messing with both Blizzy and the stock toolbar.

ATM is not messing with toolbar, it's messing with image files. You can make exceptions so icons don't resize.

just FYI, v1.7.7 not working with .25 for me. The toolbar never shows up, but there's nothing in the log to indicate a problem - the toolbar reports all its startup activities and no errors.

Reverted to 1.7.6, works fine.

Mods:

MM 2.5.1

Toolbar 1.7.7 (doesn't work) -> 1.7.6 (works)

ATM release 3-8

Chatterer 0.5.9.4 (ksp .24)

CLS 1.0.9.0

AVC 1.1.5

Goodspeed 2014.4.1b (ksp .23.5, with MM patch to update models & textures for .25. See this forum post)

(and of course Squad and NASA)

correct my punctuation

ATM is not messing with toolbar, it's messing with image files. You can make exceptions so icons don't resize.

I have the exact same problem. No toolbar showing with 1.7.7. Works fine with 1.7.6. Running 0.25 32-bit.
